title: Renovated 1998 Seabreeze
posting_body: Live in a tiny home with the cheapest rent you can find this side of the I-5 corridor!
We are selling our tiny home of four years; it's been wonderful but we're off to new adventures.
The RV itself is for sale as well as the space we are currently staying at.
It is available upon approved background check and monthly lease agreement through the park.
The RV:
Exterior:
Class A 1998 National Seabreeze (Vortex 1310)
29ft long
59,776 miles
Comes with an additional battery pack and generator
RV roof was repaired and patched this past week due to a leak in the TV antenna last winter
Interior:
Gray hardwood floor
Painted rooms
Custom couch with storage underneath.
Full bathroom with shower and toilet
Queen-sized bed included in bedroom
The main light and cabinet in the kitchen are currently being replaced/repaired (estimated to be fixed by 7/25)
Kitchen:
Three burner propane stove
A double sink
Fridge/freezer.
Plenty of cabinets and counter space for a convection oven, air fryer, mini oven, or microwave.
Hot water gauge can be finicky at times
All the comforts of an apartment but in a tiny home!
Selling for $16,500 OBO
The Space:
An RV park located in Arlington with no age restrictions for trailers.
The space is roughly 400 sqft with tree lines on either side for privacy and a shed for additional storage.
The space is big enough for the RV, with two parking spots for vehicles, and a yard.
Located right next to grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, propane distributors, a laundromat, and much more.
In addition, across the street from public transportation and half a mile from I-5
The space itself is currently $595.00 a month (subject to change depending on the park contract).
Utilities (garbage, sewage, electricity, and water) average around $120 a month.
I can send park details and contact information upon request.
The cheapest rent in the area!
Message me with any questions you have!
